section.title: Overview
section.para: The s1kd-newdm command is used to create new S1000D data modules. The following options are available:

listitem.para: -d, --defaults: Specify the path to a .defaults file
-D, --dm-types: Specify the path to a .dmtypes file
-n, --no-validate: Disable validation of DM metadata and content
-r, --responsible-partner-company: Specify the responsible partner company name
-t, --template: Specify a custom template directory path
-T, --type: Specify the data module type (e.g., dm)
-v, --verbose: Display detailed information and debug messages

section.title: Defaults File
section.para: The .defaults file sets default values for each piece of metadata. The file should be named .defaults and located in the current directory or a parent directory.

example.para: # General countryIsoCode CA languageIsoCode en originator khzae.net responsiblePartnerCompany khzae.net securityClassification 01

section.title: DM Types File
section.para: The .dmtypes file sets the default schema and info name for data modules based on their info code. The file should be named .dmtypes and located in the current directory or a parent directory.

example.para: 000 descript 022 brex Business rules 040 descript Description 520 proced Remove procedure

section.para: Alternatively, the .dmtypes file can be written in an XML format:

section.title: Custom XML Templates
section.para: Customized templates may be used with the -% option. This option takes a path to a directory where the custom templates are located.
Each template should be named <scheme>.xml, where <scheme> is the name of the schema, matching one of the schema names in the .dmtypes file or the schema specified with the -T option.

section.title: Example
section.para: This command creates a new data module with the specified DM identifier.
